intro: Scaphyglottis micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered scaphyglottis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and produces small, delicate flowers with a unique, spurred lip. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Scaphyglottis micrantha thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
